CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper April 22, 1961, pg. 2, reads: "New Fire Captain - This was the scene shortly after Director of Public Safety Louis Rosenberg, far right, and Mayor Joseph M. Barr, in center, swore in Joseph Herndon, 2105 Rose St., Fifth Ward, second from left, rear, to replace Fire Captain Frank Clark, who resigned recently. Also appointed at the same time was a white fire captain, Raymond D. Elliot, 1242 Sheffield, 21st Ward, third from left, rear, and two new members of the city's police 'brass,' Patrick J. O'Connell, far left, appointed from traffic lieutenant to traffic captain, and Rocco L. Palandro second from right, appointed traffic lieutenant. The much-desired Negro inspector of police was not named. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Police traffic captain Patrick J. O'Connell, Fire Captain Joseph Herndon, Pittsburgh Mayor Joseph M. Barr, Fire Captain Raymond D. Elliot, police traffic lieutenant Rocco L. Palandro, and Director of Public Safety Louis Rosenberg standing in Pittsburgh City Council Chambers in City County Building
